section.hand:
To my L. Treasuro
r
12 May 90

page.section:
12 May To my L Trea
s
Belgia: 1590: May
page.lettertext:
It may please y
r
L. to bee advertized that since
e writing of my last
w
ch
I sent to yo
r
L. the 9 of this moneth, wee have had no intelligence
fr
o
e Camp w
ch
came before
Nieumeghen
e 5 of this p
n
t, but
t
they cannot
fortifie as they would, for want of pioners and labouring men. The states of
Gueldreland
should have taken
e charge upon them, but yt hath bin so
neglected, as wee stand in dout yt will bring that enterprise to nothing,
since the losse of
Berck
that province hath
ceeded very coldly in all
affaires w
th
e lest of
e Provinces, for w
ch
yt hath bin feared, as yt is at this
instant, that yf yt speed not well wth the
F
r
King
, there wilbee some treaty
between th
e
& the Ennemy. Because yt was p
r
tended in that last l
re
w
ch
was sent from
e
g
na
ll states
to my
LL of
e Counsell
, that both her
Ma
ty
& my LL. receave
e informac
o
ns of mens
ceeding
in these countreyes
from passionat
sons & ignorant of their estate, I have herew
th
sent y
r
L. the copye of a remonstrance or form of complaint w
ch
was
jected
heer in Counsell at
e very same time as I lastly dealt w
th
e States.
For as I have alwaies signified this Councell of State hath ever complain
ed
of hard measure in
e g
na
l states for usurping their authoritie. Howbeyt they
have passed yt w
th
patience till now that yt came to so great a contempt
as they might not w
th
theyr credit & theyr othes to the state supporte yt
any longer, wheruppon they made choise of a principall
son to sett
downe the foresayd remonstrance in theyr behalfs, w
ch
yo
r
L. will finde
in substance to bee consonant w
th
mine, though neither
ty was privy to
other alleagations. And wheras they object that her Ma
ty
is ill
informed, yt is but a bare assertion devised onely to darken &
obscure an apparant matter for yf they should mean those informations
w
ch
have come by my l
res
I do assure yo
r
L. for mine owne
te
t
I
cannot bee more carefull then I have bin & will bee, to adv
r
tise
nothing for certain unles I know yt to bee certain, & whatsoev
r
ys doutfull
to report yt thereafter. For
e avoyding of offence, w
ch
some
haps
might take up
o
e divulging of a matter of councell, I am to request yo
r
L.
that yt may not any way be notified, that yo
u
have Rxd this writing
from mee. The brute goeth heer for certain
t
the
Duc de Maine
hath
bin of late at
Cambray
to deal w
th
Mons
r
Baligny
e Governo
r
there
about reducing that towen to
e Spaniardes possession, w
ch
hath also bin
sollicited w
th
spetiall instance by those of
Artois
and
Hennault
. But yt is
said hee failed of his purpose & de
ted from thence to Perone deepe l y
discontented/.
